alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Garfield; Iron; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 28 at 4:47AM MST until February 28 at 5:30AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Garfield County in southern Utah... Northwestern Washington County in southwestern Utah... Southeastern Beaver County in southern Utah... Central Iron County in southern Utah... * Until 530 AM MST * At 445 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 15 miles southwest of Beaver to 9 miles northeast of Beaver Dam, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 47 and 117. US Route 89 between mile markers 144 and 147. Utah Route 18 between mile markers 16 and 51. Utah Route 21 between mile markers 90 and 107. Utah Route 56 between mile markers 18 and 61. Locations impacted include... Cedar City, Beaver, Enoch, Parowan, Paragonah, New Harmony, Dameron Valley, Summit, Enterprise, Minersville, Pinto, Pine Valley, Adamsville, Newcastle, Veyo, Hamilton Fort and Gunlock. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
